context_bundle.summary: Rust error handling with Result and Option types, ? operator, thiserror for custom errors, and anyhow for application errors

onboarding.quick_start: cargo add thiserror anyhow && cargo build
common_patterns: Result type: 'fn divide(a: i32, b: i32) -> Result<i32, String> { if b == 0 { Err("division by zero".to_string()) } else { Ok(a / b) } }'
? operator: 'fn read_file() -> Result<String, std::io::Error> { let content = std::fs::read_to_string("file.txt")?; Ok(content) }'
Option type: 'fn find_user(id: u32) -> Option<User> { users.get(&id).cloned() }'
Match: 'match result { Ok(value) => println!("Success: {}", value), Err(e) => eprintln!("Error: {}", e) }'
Thiserror: '#[derive(thiserror::Error, Debug)] enum MyError { #[error("not found")] NotFound, #[error("invalid: {0}")] Invalid(String) }'
Anyhow: 'use anyhow::{Result, Context}; fn process() -> Result<()> { let data = read_file().context("failed to read")?; Ok(()) }'
Unwrap: 'let value = result.unwrap(); // panics on Err, use only when certain'
Unwrap_or: 'let value = result.unwrap_or(default); // provides default on Err'
known_errors: unwrap on None/Err: Use pattern matching or ? operator, avoid unwrap in production
error type mismatch: Use From trait or map_err to convert error types
? operator not working: Ensure function returns Result or Option
error context lost: Use anyhow::Context trait to add context
custom error not Display: Implement Display trait or use thiserror
panic in production: Replace unwrap/expect with proper error handling
